data.text: This is King Solomon’s most beautiful song.
The fragrance of the cologne on your skin is very sweet/pleasing [CHI].
But do not stare at me because of the sun having caused my skin to become dark;
You whom I [SYN] love, where will you take your flock of sheep today?
You who are the most beautiful of all the women,
You are beautiful, my darling, like the young female horse
Your cheeks are decorated with jewelry,
We will make for you some gold earrings
While the king was on his couch,
The man who loves me is as delightful as [MET] a ◄sachet/small cloth bag► of myrrh between my breasts.
He is like [MET] a bunch of flowers from the vineyards at En-Gedi.
You whom I love, you are beautiful;
You who love me, you are very delightful/handsome,
Branches of cedar trees will shade us;
